advertiserAttributionTagMap.description: A list of advertisers and associated attribution tags.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response. Possible value of code is "200", "207", "400", "401", "429", "403", or "500".

details.description: A human-readable description of the response.

allOf.description: The identifier of a macro publisher.
The identifier of a publisher that does not support macros.

macroEnabled.description: Set to 'true' if Amazon Attribution provides macro tags for the given publisher.

ReportEntry.description: Report entry object in GetReport reports list.

adGroupId.description: An ad group external identifier. Applies to `PERFORMANCE` and `PRODUCTS` reportType.

advertiserName.description: Name of advertiser. Applies to `PERFORMANCE` and `PRODUCTS` reportType.

brandName.description: Name of the advertiser's brand. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

campaignId.description: A campaign external identifier. Applies to `PERFORMANCE` and `PRODUCTS` reportType.

creativeId.description: A creative external identifier. Applies only to `PERFORMANCE` reportType

date.description: Date on which the events took place. Applies to `PERFORMANCE` and `PRODUCTS` reportType.

marketplace.description: The Amazon-owned site the product is sold on. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

productAsin.description: A unique block of letters and/or numbers that identify all products sold on Amazon. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

productCategory.description: A classification for the type of product being sold which determines its place in the Amazon retail catalog. Contains categories of products. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

productConversionType.description: The conversion type describes whether the conversion happened on a promoted or a brand halo ASIN. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

productGroup.description: A distinct product grouping distinguishing products like watches from video games from toys. Contains groups of products. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

productName.description: The name of the product. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType.

productSubcategory.description: A classification for the type of product being sold which determines its place in the Amazon retail catalog. Contains subcategories of products. Applies only to `PRODUCTS` reportType

publisher.description: The publisher name. Applies to `PERFORMANCE` and `PRODUCTS` reportType

ReportRequestBody.description:
Report request body. 
Two types of reports are available: Performance or Products - choose by including the `reportType` property.

advertiserIds.description: One or more advertiser Ids to filter reporting by. If requesting reporting for multiple advertiser Ids, input via a comma-delimited list.

count.description: The number of entries to include in the report.

cursorId.description: The value of `cursorId` must be set to `null` without `""`, or set to `""` for the first request. For each following request, the value of `cursorId` from the previous response must be included in the current request. Note that for the cursorId values the `"` character must be escaped with `\`.

endDate.description: The end date for the report, form as "YYYYMMDD"

groupBy.description: For Performance report only - controls level of aggregation. Value can be `CAMPAIGN`, `ADGROUP`, or `CREATIVE`. Default is `CREATIVE`.

metrics.description: A comma-delimited list of metrics to include in the report. In the report, each metric’s value reflects the events which took place on the row’s date; in other words, events are reported on the date t...

reportType.description: The type of report. Either `PERFORMANCE` or `PRODUCTS`. It is an optional parameter. If not used in request body, default reportType is `PERFORMANCE`.

startDate.description: The start date for the report, in "YYYYMMDD" format. For reportType `PRODUCTS`, startDate can only be within last 90 days from current date.

cursorId.description: The identifier of the pagination cursor.

attributionTagMap.description: An object representing the association between a publisher identifier and an attribution tag.

get.description: For sellers, an attribution profile has one associated advertiser. For vendors, an attribution profile may have more than one associated advertiser.

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

get.summary: Gets a list of advertisers associated with an Amazon Attribution account.

get.description: Use the response to determine whether to use either the macroTags or nonMacroTemplateTags resource to get tags for a certain publisher.

403.description: Forbidden. Request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

post.summary: Gets an attribution report for a specified list of advertisers.

get.description: Third-party publishers, such as Google Ads, Facebook, Microsoft Ads, and Pinterest support tags that include macro parameters.

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: A list of publisher identifiers for which to request tags.
parameters.name: publisherIds

parameters.description:
List of advertiser identifiers for which to request tags.
If no values are passed, all advertisers are returned.
parameters.name: advertiserIds

400.description: Invalid request, publisher not supported, or invalid advertiser identifier.

401.description: Unauthorized. Request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

403.description: Forbidden. Request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource.

429.description: Too Many Requests. Request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

get.summary: Gets a list of attribution tags for third-party publisher campaigns that support macros.

get.description: Some third-party publishers do not support tags that include macro parameters. In this case, the attribution tag includes a set of '**insertValue**' placeholder values.
